summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys discussing coordination on the Jeffrey Epstein case in the Southern District of New York. It shows communication between a defense attorney and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding scheduling a call and following up on a meeting.

persons.name: Daniel J. Kaiser
persons.context: Attorney from Kaiser Saurborn & Mair, P.C. who is in Boston for a deposition and offers to speak about the Epstein case between 1:00 and 2:00 PM.

persons.name: William H. Kaiser
persons.context: Appears to be associated with Daniel J. Kaiser at Kaiser Saurborn & Mair, P.C., and is included in the email signature.

persons.name: Dan, Kimberly
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York who is following up on discussions regarding the Epstein case and requesting a brief call.

connections.description: Communicating about the Epstein case, with the defense attorney and prosecutor coordinating a call.
Both are attorneys at the same law firm, Kaiser Saurborn & Mair, P.C.

events.title: Email request for call on Epstein case
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Dan, Kimberly emails Daniel J. Kaiser to schedule a brief call regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Response regarding call availability
events.description: Daniel J. Kaiser responds while in Boston for a deposition, offering to speak between 1:00 and 2:00 PM.

events.title: Meeting on Epstein case
events.description: Reference to a meeting that occurred, with thanks for handling it professionally.

keyFacts: The email chain shows ongoing communication between defense attorneys and prosecutors in the SDNY Epstein case in July 2019.
Daniel J. Kaiser, a defense attorney, was in Boston for a deposition but available to discuss the Epstein case.
A meeting regarding the Epstein case took place around July 13-14, 2019, involving the legal teams.
The correspondence indicates coordination and professional interaction between the defense and prosecution teams.
